title: MAG 122 - Zombie Transcript
text:
The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
1 
 
MAG – 122 – Zombie 
Content Warnings 
- Body horror 
- Mortality 
- Undead 
- Stalking 
- Existential horror 
- Imposter 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill presents The Magnus Archives. Episode one hundred and twenty-
two. Zombie. 
[Tape clicks on. Sound of clock ticking. Voices are slightly muffled] 
BASIRA 
Well? 
GEORGIE 
It was just there. 
BASIRA 
Could he have come back, moved it? 
GEORGIE 
I guess. 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
2 
 
BASIRA 
And you’re sure you didn’t recognise him? 
GEORGIE 
No. No, he was, um… I’d never seen him before. 
BASIRA 
But? 
GEORGIE 
He, uh, he felt like Death. 
BASIRA 
What, capital ‘D’ Death? 
GEORGIE 
Yeah, you know, one of your dark gods. 
BASIRA 
They’re not— 
Look, I’m trying to help. You came to me. 
GEORGIE 
I came to Melanie. 
BASIRA 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
3 
 
Well, sorry. right now, I’m it. 
… 
So, John told you then? 
GEORGIE 
Some of it. Not everything. 
BASIRA 
Right. So how exactly is it that you’re able to identify an avatar of The End on 
sight? 
GEORGIE 
Honestly, Basira, it’s not your business. 
Sorry. 
BASIRA 
(Sigh) Alright. And you don’t know why this guy would have left a tape 
recorder? 
GEORGIE 
You’re the detective. 
BASIRA 
And you’re sure it was him who left it? 
GEORGIE 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
4 
 
I mean, the nurses said there were no other visitors, so unless it appeared by 
magic? What, seriously? 
BASIRA 
I don’t know. The whole tape thing is... I don’t know. 
GEORGIE 
Right. Well, I showed you like you asked, so... 
BASIRA 
Shh. 
[Fabric moves; voices become clearer] 
Down here! 
[Tape recorder is picked up and put on table] 
GEORGIE 
I told you. 
BASIRA 
This is the one? 
GEORGIE 
Sure. 
BASIRA 
You don’t sound very sure. 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
5 
 
GEORGIE 
I mean, I don’t know, it might be a different model, maybe? I thought it was 
plastic, but, yeah. So, what does it mean? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Weakly) That’s a very good question. 
GEORGIE 
John! 
BASIRA 
Oh Jesus! 
ARCHIVIST 
(Hoarsely) Sorry. Didn’t mean to scare you. 
GEORGIE 
I’ll get a nurse. 
BASIRA 
Wait. 
GEORGIE 
Basira. 
BASIRA 
John, is it still… you? 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
6 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Uh, y-yes. Yes, I-I think so? I, uh, I don’t know how you’d prove it though. 
GEORGIE 
Enough, just stay still. I’ll get a nurse. 
ARCHIVIST 
Uh, no, I, uh, I’m alright. 
[Bedclothes rustle] 
GEORGIE 
Stop it. 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m okay. 
GEORGIE 
John, you are not okay. You have been in a coma. 
ARCHIVIST 
Wait, wait. How long? 
BASIRA 
Six months. Give or take. 
ARCHIVIST 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
7 
 
Six… Uh, the others? T-Tim, is he...? 
… 
Oh. 
BASIRA 
Daisy too. 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m sorry. 
BASIRA 
Yeah. 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. 
GEORGIE 
John. 
ARCHIVIST 
It’s alright. 
GEORGIE 
Just stay still, please. How are you feeling? 
ARCHIVIST 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
8 
 
Honestly, I, I think I’m alright. 
(Georgie sighs deeply) 
ARCHIVIST 
I mean, that’s… good, right? I— 
GEORGIE 
After a six-month coma? No, it’s not. This isn’t how it’s supposed to go, John. 
ARCHIVIST 
I— What? Y-You’d prefer I was... brain damaged? D-Dead? 
BASIRA 
John… 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
BASIRA 
Georgie, could you give us a minute? There are some things we should 
probably discuss? 
GEORGIE 
(Irritated) Fine. 
ARCHIVIST 
Georgie, I— 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
9 
 
GEORGIE 
John, if this really is a second chance, please try to take it. But I don’t think that 
it is. 
ARCHIVIST 
Georgie, I don’t—! 
GEORGIE 
Take care of yourself. 
(The Archivist sighs and attempts to speak) 
[Door opens and closes as Georgie leaves] 
ARCHIVIST 
What about you? Disappointed to see me alive? 
Basira? 
BASIRA 
We can deal with it later. 
ARCHIVIST 
Yeah, okay. 
BASIRA 
Do you want me to grab you some water, or...? 
ARCHIVIST 

The Magnus Archives – 122 – Zombie 
 
10 
 
No, the, uh, uh, the statement. In your, in your bag. 
BASIRA 
Oh. Yeah, I, uh... 
[Zip opens] 
BASIRA 
I just grabbed one on the way out. I thought maybe you’d need it for— 
ARCHIVIST 
You, you were right. I, I think it would do me some good. Do you have a tape 
re— Oh. 
BASIRA 
How did you know I brought one? 
… 
Right. 
ARCHIVIST 
Thank you, Basira. 
BASIRA 
Hmm. 
[Door opens and closes]
